q: in ring MUNCIE, Ind.-- U.S. Mike Pence discussed his political future-- in somewhat nonspecific terms-- while addressing students in a Central High School social studies class Friday. Mike Pence acknowledged he was considering maybe coming home and running for governor, but the Republican said he was likely months away from making a final decision. He didn't completely rule out seeking a seventh term representing Indiana's 6th District in the U.S. House. While

Fending off the suggestion that the pressure it was feeling from the rise of Facebook had forced the change, Mr Eric Schmidt added: This is definitely not because of any one competitor. It's about the rate at which we operate. Debate about whether Google has lost its edge has been rife in Silicon Valley tech circles in recent months. from his last time at the helm.`` My fear would be you don't have a guy like Eric Schmidt who keeps the trains running on time,'' said one former Google employee. I'm having a hard time imagining Larry Page going from the role I've seen him in, to going to a CEO role, he added.`` He can't come in and lay on the couch as he used to do and sort of interject here and there. , whether running for governor or staying where he's at in Congress. I just want him representing Indiana in some capacity,'' Hollis added. Ben Young of Richmond thinks Mike Pence made the right decision. My hope is that he runs for governor. I think it's rather fortuitous that it's open at this particular time, Ben Young said.`` I think it's obvious that he wants to serve in perhaps a higher capacity.'' Last year, for example, SIFMA lobbied against a bill that requires marketing intermediaries, who help investment funds win multibillion-dollar deals with state pension funds, to register as lobbyists with the state.
